text: Barrett Deems (March 1, 1914 - September 15, 1998) was an American swing music jazz drummer. ==Early life== Deems was born in Springfield, Illinois on March 1, 1914. ==Career== He was probably best known for his work with jazz musicians Jimmy Dorsey, Louis Armstrong (he performed as part of Armstrong's band in the 1956 musical High Society), Red Norvo, and Muggsy Spanier. ==Death== Deems died of pneumonia in Chicago, in September 1998, at the age of 84.Thedeadrockstarsclub.com - accessed SEptember 2010 ==References== ==Other websites== *Barrett Deems page at Drummerworld Category:1914 births Category:1998 deaths Category:Deaths from pneumonia Category:Infectious disease deaths in Chicago Category:American jazz musicians Category:American drummers Category:Musicians from Springfield, Illinois
title: Barrett Deems
